text: KSMM (1470 AM) is a radio station licensed to serve the community of Liberal, Kansas. The station is owned by Monte and Doris Miller, through licensee Rocking M Media, LLC, and airs an oldies format as a simulcast of sister station KAHE. The station was assigned the call sign KLIB by the Federal Communications Commission on July 20, 1960. The station changed the call sign to KILS on March 1, 1985, to KYUU on October 4, 1988, when it was part of the "LS Network" of Kansas radio entrepreneur Larry Steckline.Harris News Service: "Radio station to expand coverage," December 16, 1988, Salina Journal, retrieved from Newspapers.com OCR text, July 26, 2020 The call sign changed to KSMM on February 13, 2008. ==References== ==External links== * Official Website * FCC Public Inspection File for KSMM * FCC History Card for KSMM * SMM (AM) Category:Radio stations established in 1960 Category:1960 establishments in Kansas Category:Oldies radio stations in the United States Category:Seward County, Kansas
title: KSMM (AM)
